Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ الَّذِي لَا يَمَلُّ مِنْ تَعَلُّمِ الْعِلْمِ
enWisdom: The scholar is a person who does not get weary of gaining knowledge

Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ مَنْ لَا يَشْبَعُ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ وَلَا يَتَشَبَّعُ بِهِ
enWisdom: The scholar is one who is not satisfied with [his] knowledge nor does he allow himself to be satiated by it

Wisdom: النَّاسُ ثَلَاثَةٌ فَعَالِمٌ رَبَّانِيٌّ وَمُتَعَلِّمٌ عَلَى سَبِيلِ نَجَاةٍ وَهَمَجٌ رَعَاعٌ أَتْبَاعُ كُلِّ نَاعِقٍ لَمْ يَسْتَضِيئُوا بِنُورِ الْعِلْمِ وَلَمْ يَلْجَئُوا إِلَى رُكْنٍ وَثِيقٍ
enWisdom: People are of three types: the godly scholar, the student who is on the path of salvation and the uncultivated rabble who run after every caller, neither seeking light from the effulgence of knowledge nor taking recourse to any strong support

Wisdom: اطْلُبِ الْعِلْمَ تَزْدَدْ عِلْماً
enWisdom: Seek knowledge and you will increase in knowledge

Wisdom: اقْتَنِ الْعِلْمَ فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ كُنْتَ غَنِيّاً زَانَكَ وَإِنْ كُنْتَ فَقِيراً مَانَكَ
enWisdom: Acquire knowledge, for indeed if you are wealthy it will adorn you and if you are poor it will provide for you (or guard you)

Wisdom: امْتَاحُوا مِنْ صَفْوِ عَيْنٍ قَدْ رُوِّقَتْ مِنَ الْكَدَرِ
enWisdom: Draw water from the clear spring which has been cleansed of all impurity

Wisdom: أَلَا لَا يَسْتَحْيِيَنَّ مَنْ لَا يَعْلَمُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ فَإِنَّ قِيمَةَ كُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَا يَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: Indeed, the one who does not know should never be ashamed to learn, for the value of every person is [measured by] what he knows

Wisdom: أَعْلَمُ النَّاسِ الْمُسْتَهْتَرُ بِالْعِلْمِ [أَعْمَى النَّاسِ الْعَالِمُ الْمُسْتَهْتَرُ بِالْعِلْمِ‏]
enWisdom: The most learned person is the one who is most infatuated with knowledge

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا النَّاسُ عَالِمٌ وَمُتَعَلِّمٌ وَمَا سِوَاهُمَا فَهَمَجٌ
enWisdom: Verily people are only either scholars or seekers of knowledge, all others are rabble

Wisdom: إِذَا لَمْ تَكُنْ عَالِماً نَاطِقاً فَكُنْ مُسْتَمِعاً وَاعِياً
enWisdom: If you are not an articulating scholar then be an attentive listener

Wisdom: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ الْعِلْمَ فَأَلِطُّوا [فَاكْظِمُوا] عَلَيْهِ فَلَا تَشُوبُوهُ بِهَزْلٍ فَتَمُجَّهُ الْقُلُوبُ
enWisdom: When you hear knowledge then treat it seriously and do not taint it with jesting, thereby making the hearts spit it out

Wisdom: بِالتَّعَلُّمِ يُنَالُ الْعِلْمُ
enWisdom: Through education, knowledge is gained

Wisdom: تَعَلَّمْ تَعْلَمْ وَتَكَرَّمْ تُكْرَمْ
enWisdom: Learn and you will become knowledgeable, honour and you will be honoured

Wisdom: تَعَلَّمِ الْعِلْمَ فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ كُنْتَ غَنِيّاً زَانَكَ وَإِنْ كُنْتَ فَقِيراً مَانَكَ
enWisdom: Acquire knowledge, for indeed if you are wealthy it will adorn you and if you are poor it will provide for you (or guard you)

Wisdom: عَلَى الْعَالِمِ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ وَيُعَلِّمَ النَّاسَ مَا قَدْ عَلِمَ
enWisdom: It is upon the scholar to learn that which he does not know and to teach the people what he has learnt

Wisdom: قَطَعَ الْعِلْمُ عُذْرَ الْمُتَعَلِّلِينَ
enWisdom: All knowledge that is not supported by the intellect is misguidance

Wisdom: لِطَالِبِ الْعِلْمِ عِزُّ الدُّنْيَا وَفَوْزُ الْآخِرَةِ
enWisdom: Knowledge will never bear fruit until it is accompanied by forbearance

Wisdom: لَيْسَ الْخَيْرَ أَنْ يَكْثُرَ مَالُكَ وَوُلْدُكَ إِنَّمَا الْخَيْرُ أَنْ يَكْثُرَ عِلْمُكَ وَيَعْظُمَ حِلْمُكَ
enWisdom: Goodness is not in having more wealth and children, rather goodness is only in possessing more knowledge and greater forbearance

Wisdom: مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ عَلِمَ
enWisdom: One who learns becomes knowledgeable

Wisdom: مَنْ تَفَهَّمَ فَهِمَ
enWisdom: One who tries to understand, understands

Wisdom: مَنْ فَهِمَ عَلِمَ غَوْرَ الْعِلْمِ
enWisdom: One who understands learns the depth of knowledge

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَتَعَلَّمْ لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
enWisdom: One who does not learn does not become knowledgeable

Wisdom: عَلَى الْمُتَعَلِّمِ أَنْ يَدْأَبَ نَفْسَهُ فِي طَلَبِ الْعِلْمِ وَلَا يَمَلَّ مِنْ تَعَلُّمِهِ وَلَا يَسْتَكْثِرَ مَا عَلِمَ
enWisdom: The student must discipline himself in his quest for knowledge and must neither become bored of his studies nor overestimate what he already knows

Wisdom: مَنْ كَلِفَ بِالْعِلْمِ فَقَدْ أَحْسَنَ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever hides [his] knowledge, it is as if he is an ignorant person

Wisdom: مَنْ عَلِمَ غَوْرَ الْعِلْمِ صَدَرَ عَنْ شَرَائِعِ الْحِكَمِ
enWisdom: One who learns (or lacks) the depth of knowledge proceeds (or is repelled) from the ways of wisdom

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَتَعَلَّمْ فِي الصِّغَرِ لَمْ يَتَقَدَّمْ فِي الْكِبَرِ
enWisdom: One who does not learn in his young age, does not progress in his old age

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَصْبِرْ عَلَى مَضَضِ التَّعْلِيمِ بَقِيَ فِي ذُلِّ الْجَهْلِ
enWisdom: One who does not bear the hardships of gaining knowledge (or education) remains in the abject ignorance?

Wisdom: َنْ لَمْ يُدْئِبْ [لَمْ يُذِبْ‏] نَفْسَهُ فِي اكْتِسَابِ‏ الْعِلْمِ لَمْ يُحْرِزْ قَصَبَاتِ السَّبْقِ
enWisdom: One who does not discipline himself (or spend his life) in acquiring knowledge cannot gain great successes

Wisdom: لَا يَسْتَنْكِفَنَّ مَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ يَعْلَمُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ
enWisdom: The one who does not know must never be too proud to learn

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِلْعَاقِلِ إِذَا عَلَّمَ أَنْ لَا يَعْنُفَ وَإِذَا عُلِّمَ أَنْ لَا يَأْنَفَ
enWisdom: It behoves the intelligent person not to be harsh when he teaches, and not to scorn [others] when he gains knowledge

Wisdom: لَا يُدْرَكُ الْعِلْمُ بِرَاحَةِ الْجِسْمِ
enWisdom: Knowledge is not attained with physical comfort

Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ وَالْمُتَعَلِّمُ شَرِيكَانِ فِي الْأَجْرِ وَلَا خَيْرَ فِيمَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: The scholar and the student are partners in reward; there no good in anything between this
